description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，曾任大藏大臣、内务大臣及内阁总理大臣。因其公务员出身的强硬派作风，被称为“狮子宰相”。在位期间推动恢复金本位制及签署《伦敦海军条约》，引发右翼势力不满，在东京车站遭右翼团体成员枪击，后因细菌感染伤重不治身亡。
description.en: Japanese politician who served as Minister of Finance, Home Minister, and Prime Minister. Known as the 'Lion Prime Minister' for his tough style originating from his background as a civil servant. During his tenure, he pushed for the return to the gold standard and the signing of the London Naval Treaty, which angered right-wing groups. He was shot by a right-wing group member at Tokyo Station and later died from a bacterial infection related to his wounds.

description.zh-cn: 滨口雄幸的生父。
description.en: The biological father of Hamaguchi Osachi.

description.zh-cn: 滨口雄幸的生母。
description.en: The biological mother of Hamaguchi Osachi.

description.zh-cn: 滨口雄幸的配偶。
description.en: The spouse of Hamaguchi Osachi.

description.zh-cn: 滨口雄幸的长子。
description.en: The eldest son of Hamaguchi Osachi.

description.zh-cn: 滨口雄幸的次子。
description.en: The second son of Hamaguchi Osachi.

description.zh-cn: 滨口雄幸的女婿。
description.en: Son-in-law of Hamaguchi Osachi.

description.zh-cn: 日本的一所综合性国立大学，滨口雄幸于1895年毕业于其前身东京帝国大学。
description.en: A comprehensive national university in Japan. Hamaguchi Osachi graduated from its predecessor, Tokyo Imperial University, in 1895.

description.zh-cn: 日本大正时代的政党，滨口雄幸于1915年加入。
description.en: A political party in Japan during the Taishō period, which Hamaguchi Osachi joined in 1915.

description.zh-cn: 日本大正时代的政党，由立宪同志会等合并而成，滨口雄幸曾任其总务委员。
description.en: A political party in Japan during the Taishō period, formed by the merger of the Rikken Dōshikai and others. Hamaguchi Osachi served as a member of its general affairs committee.

description.zh-cn: 日本昭和前期的政党，滨口雄幸是其首任总裁。
description.en: A political party in early Shōwa period Japan. Hamaguchi Osachi was its first president.

description.zh-cn: 日本的政府首脑，滨口雄幸于1929年至1931年间两度担任此职。
description.en: The head of government of Japan. Hamaguchi Osachi held this office twice between 1929 and 1931.

description.zh-cn: 日本第124代天皇，滨口雄幸担任首相期间的在位天皇。
description.en: The 124th Emperor of Japan, who was the reigning monarch during Hamaguchi Osachi's premiership.

description.zh-cn: 战前日本政府的中央行政机关之一，滨口雄幸曾任内务大臣。
description.en: One of the central administrative bodies of the pre-war Japanese government. Hamaguchi Osachi served as the Home Minister.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，曾任首相。滨口雄幸在其内阁中担任过内务大臣和（部分时期）大藏大臣，并在滨口内阁辞职后接任首相。
description.en: A Japanese politician who served as Prime Minister. Hamaguchi Osachi served as Home Minister and (for a period) Finance Minister in his cabinet. He also succeeded Hamaguchi as Prime Minister after his cabinet resigned.

description.zh-cn: 战前至2001年期间日本政府掌管财政、金融、税务的中央行政机关。滨口雄幸曾在此长期任职，并担任过大藏大臣。
description.en: The central administrative body of the Japanese government responsible for finance, banking, and taxation from the pre-war era until 2001. Hamaguchi Osachi had a long career here, eventually serving as Minister of Finance.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，曾任首相及宪政会总裁。滨口雄幸在其内阁中担任大藏大臣。
description.en: A Japanese politician who served as Prime Minister and President of the Kenseikai party. Hamaguchi Osachi served as Minister of Finance in his cabinet.

description.zh-cn: 日本国会的下议院，滨口雄幸曾多次当选为众议院议员。
description.en: The lower house of the National Diet of Japan. Hamaguchi Osachi was elected as a member of the House of Representatives multiple times.

description.zh-cn: 日本陆军大将及政治家，曾任首相。因张作霖暗杀事件（皇姑屯事件）总辞，由滨口雄幸接任首相。
description.en: A general in the Imperial Japanese Army and politician who served as Prime Minister. He resigned over the assassination of Zhang Zuolin (Huanggutun Incident) and was succeeded by Hamaguchi Osachi.

description.zh-cn: 一种货币制度，滨口雄幸内阁不顾反对强行推动日本恢复金本位制。
description.en: A monetary system. The Hamaguchi cabinet pushed for Japan's return to the gold standard despite opposition.

description.zh-cn: 限制海军军备的国际条约，滨口雄幸内阁签署此条约，引发了日本军方和右翼势力的强烈不满。
description.en: An international treaty for the limitation of naval armament. The Hamaguchi cabinet's signing of this treaty caused strong dissatisfaction among the Japanese military and right-wing groups.

description.zh-cn: 对滨口雄幸内阁的裁军和经济政策感到不满的日本政治势力，其成员策划并实施了对滨口雄幸的刺杀。
description.en: Japanese political forces dissatisfied with the Hamaguchi cabinet's disarmament and economic policies. A member of one such group planned and carried out the assassination attempt on Hamaguchi Osachi.

description.zh-cn: 日本右翼团体成员，在东京车站枪击了时任首相滨口雄幸。
description.en: A member of a Japanese right-wing group who shot then-Prime Minister Hamaguchi Osachi at Tokyo Station.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，在滨口雄幸遇刺受伤后，要求其前往众议院接受质询。
description.en: A Japanese politician who, after Hamaguchi Osachi was wounded in an assassination attempt, demanded that he attend the House of Representatives for questioning.

description.zh-cn: 发生于滨口雄幸首相任内，日本军队在台湾镇压原住民时使用生化武器，事件引发国际谴责并冲击了滨口内阁。
description.en: An incident that occurred during Hamaguchi Osachi's premiership, in which the Japanese army used chemical weapons to suppress indigenous people in Taiwan. The event drew international condemnation and impacted the Hamaguchi cabinet.

description.zh-cn: 大日本帝国的军事行政机关之一，与台湾总督府联合派兵镇压雾社事件。
description.en: One of the military administrative bodies of the Empire of Japan, which, in conjunction with the Governor-General of Taiwan, dispatched troops to suppress the Musha Incident.

description.zh-cn: 日治时期台湾的最高统治机关，与陆军省联合派兵镇压雾社事件。
description.en: The highest ruling body in Taiwan during the period of Japanese rule, which, in conjunction with the Ministry of the Army, dispatched troops to suppress the Musha Incident.

description.zh-cn: 滨口雄幸是水口胤平的儿子，后被过继。
description.en: Hamaguchi Osachi was the son of Mizuguchi Tanpei before being adopted.

description.zh-cn: 滨口雄幸是水口繁子的儿子。
description.en: Hamaguchi Osachi was the son of Mizuguchi Shigeko.

description.zh-cn: 滨口夏子是滨口雄幸的配偶。
description.en: Hamaguchi Natsuko was the spouse of Hamaguchi Osachi.

description.zh-cn: 滨口雄彦是滨口雄幸的长子。
description.en: Hamaguchi Takehiko was the eldest son of Hamaguchi Osachi.

description.zh-cn: 滨口岩根是滨口雄幸的次子。
description.en: Hamaguchi Iwane was the second son of Hamaguchi Osachi.

description.zh-cn: 大桥武夫是滨口雄幸的女婿。
description.en: Ōhashi Takeo was the son-in-law of Hamaguchi Osachi.

description.zh-cn: 滨口雄幸于1895年毕业于东京帝国大学（现东京大学）。
description.en: Hamaguchi Osachi graduated from Tokyo Imperial University (now the University of Tokyo) in 1895.

description.zh-cn: 滨口雄幸于1915年加入立宪同志会。
description.en: Hamaguchi Osachi joined the Rikken Dōshikai in 1915.

description.zh-cn: 在大日本帝国时期，内阁总理大臣由天皇任命，并向天皇负责。
description.en: During the Empire of Japan, the Prime Minister was appointed by and responsible to the Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 滨口雄幸在若槻礼次郎内阁中先后担任大藏大臣和内务大臣。
description.en: Hamaguchi Osachi served successively as Minister of Finance and Home Minister in the cabinet of Wakatsuki Reijirō.

description.zh-cn: 滨口雄幸在加藤高明内阁中担任大藏大臣。
description.en: Hamaguchi Osachi served as Minister of Finance in the cabinet of Katō Takaaki.

description.zh-cn: 滨口雄幸接替因张作霖暗杀事件而下台的田中义一出任首相。
description.en: Hamaguchi Osachi succeeded Tanaka Giichi as Prime Minister after Tanaka's cabinet resigned over the assassination of Zhang Zuolin.

description.zh-cn: 滨口雄幸内阁不顾右翼势力与军方的反对，强行推动恢复金本位政策。
description.en: The Hamaguchi cabinet pushed through the policy of returning to the gold standard, despite opposition from right-wing groups and the military.

description.zh-cn: 滨口雄幸内阁签署了旨在限制海军军备的《伦敦海军条约》。
description.en: The Hamaguchi cabinet signed the London Naval Treaty, which aimed to limit naval armaments.

description.zh-cn: 日本右翼团体因不满滨口雄幸的经济及裁军政策，而对其产生敌意。
description.en: Japanese right-wing groups became hostile towards Hamaguchi Osachi due to dissatisfaction with his economic and disarmament policies.

description.zh-cn: 佐乡屋留雄在东京车站开枪行刺时任首相滨口雄幸，导致其重伤，并最终因此身亡。
description.en: Sagoya Tomeo shot then-Prime Minister Hamaguchi Osachi at Tokyo Station, critically wounding him and ultimately causing his death.

description.zh-cn: 在滨口雄幸遇刺受伤后，在野党政友会成员鸠山一郎等人要求其拖着病身前往众议院接受质询，此举加重了滨口雄幸的身体负担。
description.en: After Hamaguchi Osachi was wounded, Hatoyama Ichirō, a member of the opposition party Seiyūkai, demanded that he attend the House of Representatives for questioning despite his injuries, which worsened his physical condition.

description.zh-cn: 雾社事件发生于滨口雄幸首相任内，事件引发国际与日本国会强烈谴责，导致其多名阁员引咎辞职，对滨口内阁造成了严重冲击。
description.en: The Musha Incident occurred during Hamaguchi Osachi's premiership. The event drew strong condemnation from the international community and the Japanese Diet, leading to the resignation of several cabinet members and severely impacting the Hamaguchi cabinet.

description.zh-cn: 陆军省与台湾总督府联合派兵使用生化武器镇压台湾原住民，引发雾社事件。
description.en: The Ministry of the Army, in conjunction with the Governor-General of Taiwan, dispatched troops and used chemical weapons to suppress the indigenous people of Taiwan, triggering the Musha Incident.

description.zh-cn: 台湾总督府与陆军省联合派兵使用生化武器镇压台湾原住民，引发雾社事件。
description.en: The Governor-General of Taiwan, in conjunction with the Ministry of the Army, dispatched troops and used chemical weapons to suppress the indigenous people of Taiwan, triggering the Musha Incident.
